channel.title: Home on Byron Donaldson
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Byron Donaldson

item.title: Making a Personal Running Heatmap in R & Python
item.description: Making an interactive running map Last updated: Nov 2023 “A race? You’ve lost your mind! Jogging is private, you don’t jog for an audience." Cop 223, Chungking Express I have, by now, been running for almost 6 years, cosying up to 17 000 kms. One of the treats of running is as an act of exploration. To explore on foot places you are visiting, a reason to go to a particular place, and to explore closer to home - the area you live.

item.title: Chiloe
Books
item.description: In an awful twist, I’ve come to enjoy keeping records. Channeling Garfunkel : roughly everything I’ve read since I started tracking. Some favourites might get a **. Dates are when I finished or gave up, I’m a slow reader so most were started days or months or millenia before. 2017-03-07 Ferguson, Leading 2017-06-06 Roberts, Shantaram 2017-09-21 Davis, Into the Silence ** 2017-12-16 McClear, Vietnam: The 10 000 Day War 2018-01-18 Pauw, The Presidents Keepers 2018-03-05 Ferris, Tribe of Mentors 2018-03-30 Sinek, Start with Why 2018-04-15 Loehr, The Power of Story 2018-04-30 Frankl, Mans Search for Meaning 2018-05-12 Curry, Daily Rituals: How Artists Work 2018-06-28 Harari, Homo Deus 2018-08-03 Wouk, The Hope 2018-09-14 Mujika, Endurance Running: Science & Practice 2018-10-10 Orwell, 1984 ** 2018-12-14 Kuhn, The Structure of Scientific Revolutions 2019-01-15 Hawking, A Brief History of Time 2019-02-04 Diamond, Guns, Germs and Steel 2019-02-27 Cain, Quiet 2019-03-16 Shermer, The Moral Arc 2019-04-04 Guelbenzu, La Noche en Casa 2019-04-28 Doudna, A Crack in Creation 2019-05-12 Carroll, The Big Picture 2019-05-24 Boldt, How to Find the Work You Love 2019-06-15 Russell, Human Society in Ethics and Politics 2019-06-29 Huxley, Brave New World 2019-07-12 Hemingway, For Whom The Bell Tolls 2019-07-24 Krakauer, Into Thin Air 2019-08-22 de Bono, Parallel Thinking 2019-09-05 Nietzche, Zarathustras Discourses 2019-09-06 Pressfield, Do The Work 2019-09-26 Sindermann, Winning The Games Scientists Play 2019-10-04 Aurelius, Meditations 2019-10-10 Carnegie, How to Win Friends and Influence People 2019-10-28 Taleb, The Black Swan ** 2019-11-10 Sun Tzu, The Art of War 2019-11-25 Collins, Good to Great 2019-12-29 Garcia Marquez, Cien Años de Soledad ** 2020-01-10 Ariely, Predictably Irrational (mmmmm) 2020-01-17 Gilbert, Stumbling on Happiness 2020-01-29 Garcia Marquez, Relato de un Naufrago 2020-02-04 King, On Writing 2020-02-10 Gladwell, The Tipping Point 2020-02-24 Taleb, Fooled By Randomness 2020-02-28 Rand, The Fountainhead 2020-03-10 Epstein, Range 2020-03-18 Taleb, Skin In The Game 2020-03-18 de Quevedo, La Vida Del Buscon 2020-03-25 Gladwell, Outliers 2020-04-01 Foster Wallace, Everything and More 2020-04-04 Hesse, Siddhartha ** 2020-04-06 Pressfield, The War of Art 2020-04-15 Thiel, Zero to One ** 2020-04-22 2020-05-24 Murakami, Norwegian Wood ** 2020-06-01 Camus, The Stranger ** 2020-06-06 Tolle, The Power of Now 2020-06-14 Goldacre, Bad Science 2020-06-28 Dennett, Intuition Pumps and other tools for thinking 2020-07-05 Feynman, Surely you’re joking Mr Feynman 2020-07-14 Camus, The Plague 2020-07-16 Carroll, The Big Picture 2020-07-28 Sapolsky, A Primates Memoir ** 2020-08-03 Dickens, A tale of two cities 2020-08-07 Murakami, What I Talk About When I Talk About Running 2020-08-21 Biko, I Write What I Like ** 2020-10-10 Davis, One River ** 2020-10-14 Carreyrou, Bad Blood 2020-10-30 Seneca, Letters from a Stoic 2020-11-23 Sandes, Abriendo Camino 2020-12-04 Vance, Elon Musk 2020-12-08 Dostoyevsky, Crime and Punishment ** 2020-12-12 Orwell, Animal Farm 2020-01-16 Saramago, Casi un Objeto 2021-01-09 Greene, Fabric of the Cosmos 2021-01-31 Pinker, The Language Instinct 2021-02-08 Isaacson, Steve Jobs** 2021-02-22 Graeber, Debt: The First 5000 Years 2021-03-03 Capote, In Cold Blood item.title: Links
item.description: Sometimes there are interesting things on the internet. Argentina on Two Steaks a Day, Maciej Ceglowski Las Torres del Paine, Maciej Ceglowski The Place to Disappear, Susan Orlean Switzerland: The Land of Joyce, Daniel Davies Shipping Out, David Foster Wallace Arrival - Facing the Fear of Existence, Like Stories of Old Paterson - Everyday Virtue & David Foster Wallace - Like Stories of Old E Unibus Plurum: Television and U.

item.title: Writing
item.description: Just Do 100 Things! After all, there are plenty of people writing badly on the internet, why not me? (at least, in the beginning) 1/100 Chiloe
